preview.title: We Execute Quantum Circuits
preview.text: Our software embraces the limitations of today’s quantum hardware to deliver breakthrough performance.

list.title: 100x
list.text: Execute complex quantum algorithms with 100x more operations

list.title: 4x
list.text: Extend the quantum volume of your QPU by 4x

how_it_works.title: How it works
how_it_works.text: We execute quantum algorithms as multiple modified circuits that each fit the constraints of the QPU. We combine all the results and apply noise mitigation to achieve a high-fidelity final result... in a way that scales.

example.title: Example
example.subtitle: This work made us finalists in this year’s Airbus-BMW Challenge.
example.text:
Computational fluid dynamics (CFD) simulations are one of the nearest term applications for quantum computers. Think realistic aerodynamics simulations around an airfoil or sound propagation through an environment. Fewer than 100 qubits are needed for advantage... but the circuits are thousands of gates in depth.

For the first time, our software makes it possible to run CFD circuits on real QPUs.
example.text_compatibility: Our execution technology is readily compatible with the growing middleware stack and can be integrated naturally with other compilation, error suppression, and noise mitigation techniques.

middleware.title: Our Software
middleware.text: Haiqu developing tools of other parts of the stack

list.subtitle: RIVET – Modular Transpilation
list.title: Reduce your QML runtime from hours to seconds
list.text: This transpilation SDK allows you to speeds up the transpilation time for routines involving a high-volume of circuit. Run your QML and other workloads in seconds instead of hours. And it’s open-source.

list.subtitle: Our Approximate Circuit Execution
list.title: Execute 100x deeper circuits
list.text: Our most powerful solution (in private beta). This proprietary approximate divide-and-conquer circuit execution scheme allows for the execution of circuits which are 100x deeper, as compared with any other technique on the market. We supplement this execution scheme with error mitigation and error suppression.

list.subtitle: Our Error Mitigation
list.title: High-performance, lightweight mitigation
list.text: The most effective, lowest-overhead error mitigation system on the market (in private beta). The overhead is so low you can use it during variational circuit routines! In fact, your mitigated variational routine will require fewer circuit runs to converge.
